intro: Bancalus glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular longhorned beetle, is a species of beetle belonging to the family Cerambycidae. It is characterized by its elongated body and distinctive antennae, which are longer than its body length. The beetle's exoskeleton is typically dark brown to black, with subtle iridescent markings. It is often found in forested areas, where it feeds on decaying wood and plant material. The plant associations of Bancalus glandulifer are primarily with hardwood trees, making it an important indicator species for forest health.
